newsitem.title: USA: Allstate cuts boatowners insurance premiums.
newsitem.headline: Allstate cuts boatowners insurance premiums.

text.p: Allstate Insurance Co said it would reduce boatowners insurance premiums for certain boat owners in Texas, Michigan, Arizona, California, Wisconsin and Connecticut.
In these states, boatowners insurance would fluctuate based on a boat's age, type, value, the age of operators and the type of coverage, the company said.
The new rates were effective for new business effective April 1, it said. They were effective for renewal after May 16, the company said.

Allstate said it also introduced two new discounts for boat owners. For boats up to 11 years old, a new boat discount of up to 40 percent was introduced for new and existing customers. A 15 percent discount would be applied to liability, medical payments and physical damage coverage of qualified customers who had both their boats and autos insured with Allstate, it said.
